candidates.title: feat: Factorization exporter
candidates.body:
Factorization code is complete for prometheus and riemann exporters.
Documentation and naming efforts completed.

Please have a look, feedback welcomed.

candidates.title: Feat/colored
candidates.body:
Hello @bpetit ,

This is small PR to add some colors.
It was a test and an excuse to use the colored crate.
If you dislike it feel free to cancel this PR.

candidates.title: feat: Bump dependencies version
candidates.body:
Bump version to the updated riemann-client. (https://github.com/borntyping/rust-riemann_client/pull/6 and https://github.com/borntyping/rust-riemann_client/pull/7)

- Bump riemann client to 0.9.0
- Bump protobuff to 2.20.0

candidates.title: feat: add json reporter
candidates.body:
Add JSON reporter.

You can use the following options:
- -t to customize the timeout
- -s to customize the interval
- -f to change the destination file where to write the report

If no file is provided, then the JSON is displayed in the console.
If the directory where to create the file does not exist it will fail.

TODO:
- interval should be in milliseconds or should at least allows sending float number.
- documentation

candidates.title: Feat/riemann exporter
candidates.body:
First "version" of Riemann exporter.

The implementation was done as a proof of concept. So I tried to do it minimizing the modifications to the existing files.
This is inspired and not so far from the Prometheus one.
As a result it works fine, but there are a lot of duplications in the code currently.

Future improvements could be to:
* Split the run method which is as long as hell.
* Factorize code which is pretty similar in Prometheus and Riemann (mostly run method) in the Exporter trait and just change the way metrics are exposed or sent.

Sorry this PR is a bit large, but it mostly introduced new files, so it can probably be merged without being too worried about it.
Note, I have also fixed a couple of typos in Prometheus exporter.
